trans-unit.source: The Localization class defines attached properties for localization attributes and comments.
Markup authors may have specific requirements for elements in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] UI, such as constraints for text length, font family, or font size.
Localizers need to know about them in order to provide consistent localization.
Localization properties can be specified inside [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], allowing authors to communicate their localization needs to localizers.
These properties provide rules and hints for localization, which can be used to modify the application.
There are two types of localization properties: - Localization attributes.
The attributes specify which resources, such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily>, are to be localized.
- Localization comments.
The comments are free-form text that the markup author includes.
For more information on how to use these localization properties, see [Localization Attributes and Comments](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Localization.Attributes*> attached property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Localization.Comments*> attached property.
To be added.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Localization.AttributesProperty"></xref> attached property from a specified element.
Localization attributes specify which resources are to be localized.
A <xref:System.Object> that represents the element whose attached property you want to retrieve.
A <xref:System.String> value that represents the localization attribute.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Localization.CommentsProperty"></xref> attached property from a specified element.
Localization comments are free-form text that the application developer includes.
A <xref:System.Object> that represents the element whose attached property you want to retrieve.
A <xref:System.String> value that represents the localization comment.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Localization.AttributesProperty"></xref> attached property for the specified element.
Localization attributes specify which resources are to be localized.
For more information on how to define localization attributes, see [Localization Attributes and Comments](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref:System.Object> that represents the element whose attached property you want to set.
A <xref:System.String> that specifies the localization attributes.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Localization.CommentsProperty"></xref> attached property to the specified element.
Localization comments are free-form text that the application developer includes.
For more information on how to define localization comments, see [Localization Attributes and Comments](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref:System.Object> that represents the element whose attached property you want to set.
A <xref:System.String> that specifies the localization comments.
